name: insisting
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
insist
B1 to say firmly or demand forcefully, especially when others disagree with or oppose what you say: [ + (that) ] Greg still insists (that) he did nothing wrong. Please go first - I insist! She insisted on seeing her lawyer.
More examplesFewer examplesShe's 85 now, but she will insist on doing all her own housework.The men at City Hall insist that big spending cuts are just not practical.The police insist that they are not relaxing their campaign against drugs.They insisted that all swear words be deleted from the article.She insisted on telling me every single detail of what they did to her in hospital.
